  "article_text": [
    "let @xmath0 be a complex , connected , simple algebraic group and let @xmath1 and @xmath2 be a borel subgroup and maximal torus of @xmath0 contained in @xmath1 . for an integral dominant weight @xmath3 , denote by @xmath4 the integrable highest weight @xmath0-module with highest weight @xmath3 .",
    "the demazure modules @xmath5 ( with @xmath6 running over the weyl group of @xmath0 ) form a filtration of @xmath4 . the module @xmath5 is defined as the @xmath1submodule of @xmath4 generated by the extremal weight space of weight @xmath7 ( which are one  dimensional ) . in particular , if @xmath8 is the longest element in the weyl group of @xmath0 , @xmath9 is precisely @xmath4 .",
    "more importantly , the demazure modules can be realized as spaces of global sections of certain line bundles over schubert varieties ( see section [ demazure ] for details ) .",
    "the main goal of this note is to explain how the recent developments @xcite , @xcite in the theory of nonsymmetric macdonald polynomials have as consequence a geometric formula for weight multiplicities in demazure modules and , in particular , irreducible @xmath0modules .",
    "we will briefly state our result .",
    "let @xmath10 be the unique complex , connected , reductive group whose root datum is dual to that of @xmath0 .",
    "let us also consider @xmath11 , a borel subgroup of @xmath12 .",
    "the group @xmath12 is also defined over @xmath13 $ ] .",
    "we denote @xmath14 by @xmath15 and let @xmath16 be the subgroup of @xmath15 defined as the inverse image of @xmath17 under the reduction map @xmath18 .",
    "the space @xmath19 is endowed with a structure of ind  variety over @xmath20 . for any integral weights @xmath3 and @xmath21 let @xmath22 be the finite dimensional subvariety of @xmath19 defined in section [ varieties ] .",
    "[ thm1 ] let @xmath3 and @xmath21 be two integral weights such that @xmath23 .",
    "the weight multiplicity @xmath24 of the weight @xmath3 in the demazure module @xmath25 equals the number of top dimensional irreducible components of @xmath22 .",
    "other geometric formulas for weight multiplicities in irreducible @xmath0modules exist in the literature @xcite , @xcite but no such formula was available for demazure modules .",
    "our result is similar to one consequence ( * ? ? ?",
    "* corollary 7.4 ) of the recent work of mirkovi ' c and vilonen on the geometric satake isomorphism ( see [ remarks ] on further comments about this connection ) .",
    "however , we should keep in mind that the demazure modules are generally just @xmath1modules and their result covers only the case of reductive groups ; it would be interesting to investigate if the ideas in @xcite could be used to cover a larger class of groups .",
    "i would like to thank brian conrad for a clarifying conversation .",
    "[ [ section ] ]    let @xmath26 be the complex , simple lie algebra of rank @xmath27 and let @xmath28 and @xmath29 be a cartan subalgebra and , respectively , a borel subalgebra containing @xmath28 .",

    "[ [ section-3 ] ]    the bruhat order is a partial order on any coxeter group defined in way compatible with the length function . for an element @xmath6 we put @xmath98   if and only if  @xmath99 .",
    "the transitive closure of this relation is called the bruhat order .",
    "the terminology is motivated by the way this ordering arises for weyl groups in connection with inclusions among closures of bruhat cells for a corresponding semisimple algebraic group .",
    "we can use the bruhat order on @xmath63 to define a partial order on the weight lattice which will also be called the bruhat order . for any @xmath100",
    "we write @xmath101 the minimal elements of the weight lattice with respect to this partial order are the minuscule weights and if @xmath102 then necessarily @xmath103 .",
    "[ lemma2 ] let @xmath3 and @xmath21 be two weights such that @xmath23 .",

    "let @xmath0 be a complex , connected , simple algebraic group with lie algebra @xmath31 and denote by @xmath2 and @xmath1 the maximal torus and the borel subgroup of @xmath0 with lie algebras @xmath28 and @xmath29 , respectively .",
    "for an integral dominant weight @xmath3 , denote by @xmath4 the integrable highest weight @xmath26-module with highest weight @xmath3 .",
    "it is well known that @xmath4 is an irreducible @xmath110module .",
    "hence , for any @xmath6 in @xmath67 the @xmath7weight space @xmath111 is one  dimensional . the _ demazure module _",
    "@xmath5 is defined as the @xmath112module generated by @xmath113 .",
    "since @xmath3 is integral @xmath5 is also a @xmath1module .",
    "the demazure modules associated to a fixed integral dominant weight @xmath3 form a filtration ( with respect to the bruhat order on @xmath67 ) of @xmath4 .",
    "in particular , @xmath114 and @xmath115 .    there exists an important geometrical construction of demazure modules which relates them with the geometry of schubert varieties in the flag variety @xmath116 . for any @xmath6 in @xmath67 let @xmath117 denote the schubert variety associated to @xmath6 .",
    "the schubert varieties are closed finite dimensional projective irreducible subvarieties of @xmath116 . for any integral weight @xmath3",
    "we denote by @xmath118 the character of @xmath1 obtained from @xmath2 via the isomorphism @xmath119 $ ] .",
    "consider the fiber product @xmath120 , where @xmath121 denotes @xmath20 equipped with the @xmath1action given by the character @xmath118 .",
    "the natural projection @xmath122 induces a well defined @xmath0equivariant holomorphic map @xmath123 ; in other words @xmath124 becomes a @xmath0equivariant holomorphic line bundle over @xmath116 . by restriction",
    "we obtain a line bundle @xmath125 over @xmath126 .",
    "since @xmath126 is @xmath1invariant , the space of holomorphic sections @xmath127 admits a @xmath1module structure .",
    "the relation with the demazure module @xmath5 is the following .",
    "let @xmath3 be a dominant integral weight and let @xmath6 be an element of @xmath63 .",
    "then , @xmath5 and @xmath128 are isomorphic as @xmath1modules .",
    "the result holds in the more general setting of generalized flag varieties of kac  moody groups . for a proof see , for example , corollary 8.1.26 in @xcite .",

    "similarly , the algebra @xmath144 $ ] is the group @xmath142-algebra of the lattice @xmath36 .    the nonsymmetric macdonald polynomials @xmath145 associated to the root system @xmath30 are remarkable family of polynomials indexed by the weight lattice @xmath36 and which form a basis for @xmath146 .",
    "they were defined by opdam and macdonald for various specializations of the parameters and in full generality by cherednik @xcite .",
    "we refer the reader to @xcite for a detailed account of their construction and basic properties .",
    "we only mention at this point that they satisfy the following triangularity property with respect to the bruhat order @xmath147    [ [ section-5 ] ]    although , a priori , the coefficients of the polynomials @xmath145 are just rational functions in @xmath136 and @xmath137 it was proved in ( * ? ? ?",
    "* section 3.1 ) that in fact each coefficient has a finite limit as @xmath136 approaches infinity and , in consequence , @xmath148 is well defined as an element of @xmath149 .",
    "another important fact is that the coefficients of @xmath150 are polynomials in @xmath151 and in consequence their limit as @xmath137 approaches infinity is finite .",
    "moreover , the following is true .",

    "let us assume for a moment that @xmath208 .",
    "it is well  known ( see , for example , @xcite and the references therein ) that the space @xmath209 is an _ ind  variety _",
    "( i.e. admits an increasing filtration with varieties such all inclusion maps among them are closed embeddings ) defined over @xmath20 .",
    "we refer the reader to ( * ? ? ?",
    "* chapter iv ) for a brief introduction to ind  varieties . in our case ,",
    "the members of the filtration on @xmath209 can be constructed from a filtration of @xmath12 obtained by bounding the number of poles with respect to @xmath172 of the matrix coefficients for a faithful representation of @xmath12 .    the space @xmath210 is usually referred to as the _ affine grassmannian _ of @xmath211 . however , because @xmath212 and @xmath15 are still defined for @xmath213 , the same geometric constructions go through in this case , and @xmath209 acquires a structure of ind  variety defined over @xmath168 ( see also the remarks in section 14 of @xcite ) . in a completely similar way , keeping in mind that @xmath16 is defined for @xmath213 , we endow @xmath214 with a structure of ind  variety defined over @xmath168 .",
    "let us consider the map @xmath215 .",
    "the group @xmath15 acts on @xmath214 by finite dimensional orbits .",
    "indeed , the orbits are all of the form @xmath216 , and the number of poles of the elements in @xmath217 is bounded by @xmath218 therefore , @xmath216 is included in one member of the filtration on @xmath214 and hence it is finite dimensional . for any @xmath3 and @xmath21 in @xmath219 , let us define the variety @xmath220 as @xmath221 . from the above considerations it is clear that the varieties @xmath220 are finite dimensional and defined over @xmath168 .",
    "we will show that the right hand side of the formula ( [ eq5 ] ) equals the number of irreducible components of top dimension of @xmath22 .",
    "let us recall that corollary [ cor1 ] holds under the hypothesis @xmath222 .",
    "because the iwahori subgroup @xmath16 has volume one we can regard the volume of the set @xmath223 as the number of right @xmath16cosets in @xmath223 or , equivalently , as the number of points in @xmath224 ( which we denote by @xmath225 ) .    the lefschetz fixed point formula ( for the frobenius automorphism ) and theorem 1 in @xcite ( for @xmath226 , @xmath227 and @xmath228 ) let us conclude that @xmath229 is indeed the number of irreducible components of top dimension of @xmath22 .          if we keep in mind that for anti ",
    "dominant @xmath3 the demazure module @xmath25 is in fact @xmath230 , the irreducible @xmath0module with highest weight @xmath231 ( or lowest weight @xmath3 ) , our result gives a geometric formula for the weight multiplicities of @xmath230 .",
    "however , if we would be only interested in a formula for weight multiplicities in @xmath232 ( here @xmath3 is dominant ) , this could be obtained by closely following the argument given above but replacing in theorem [ limit ] the nonsymmetric macdonald polynomials with symmetric macdonald polynomials @xmath233 ( at @xmath234 ) and theorem [ padic ] with corresponding result stating the fact that @xmath235 arises as the satake transform of the characteristic function of the set @xmath236 . if we denote by @xmath237 the @xmath20points of the image of @xmath238 through the map @xmath239 the corresponding result read as follows .",
    "[ thm2 ] let @xmath3 and @xmath21 be two dominant integral weights such that @xmath23 .",
    "the weight multiplicity @xmath24 of the weight @xmath21 in the irreducible highest weight module @xmath4 equals the number of top dimensional irreducible components of @xmath237 .",
    "the above statement is quite close to one of results in @xcite which we will briefly recall . for the following statements we assume that @xmath208 .",
    "first , theorem 3.2 in @xcite shows that @xmath240 ( the closure is in @xmath209 ) is pure dimensional ( which , of course , implies that @xmath241 is pure dimensional ) .",
    "second , as a consequence of the equivalence of tensor categories between the category of representations of @xmath0 and the category of @xmath15equivariant perverse sheaves on the affine grassmannian @xmath209 with @xmath20coefficients , corollary 7.4 in @xcite states that the weight multiplicity @xmath24 equals the number of irreducible components of @xmath242 .",
    "the absence of the closure in theorem [ thm2 ] slightly improves this statement .    the main result in @xcite ( the above mentioned equivalence of categories )",
    "was proved for reductive groups .",
    "keeping in mind that theorem [ thm1 ] holds for demazure modules ( which are just @xmath1modules ) and that @xmath1 is a solvable group , our result seems to suggest that the results of mirkovi ' c and vilonen might eventually be extended to a larger class of groups and representations .                    , singularities , character formulas , and a @xmath136analog of weight multiplicities .",
    "analysis and topology on singular spaces , ii , iii ( luminy , 1981 ) , _ ast ' erisque _ * 101102 * , 208229 , soc .",
    "france , paris , 1983 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we establish a formula for the weight multiplicities of demazure modules ( in particular for highest weight representations ) of a complex connected algebraic group in terms of the geometry of its langlands dual . </S>"
  ]
}
